intro: Pentace cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf pentace, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
